about.content: Hello! I'm La Kieu Ngoc Thang. Currently, I am a student at Hanoi University of Science and Technology, majoring in Multimedia Engineering. My specialization lies in Machine Learning, Computer Vision, and Image Processing.

timeline.institution: Hanoi University of Science and Technology
details: Specialization in Computer Vision and Image Processing.

description: Working on the topic: Dive into Generative Al on Cloud: Toward User-Centered Innovation.

timeline.organization: Computer Vision Laboratory - International Research Institute MICA (HUST)
description: Focus on solving the problem of Lesion Segmentation on Medical Endoscopy Images using Language-Vision Models.

carousel.title: Fourier-based Diffusion Model
carousel.description: Use Fourier transform to separate data into high and low-frequency components, apply different diffusion methods, and then use inverse Fourier transform to reconstruct the processed data.

carousel.title: Adaptive Diffusion Model Using Learned Kernels
carousel.description: Employ neural networks to learn adaptive diffusion kernels, adjusting diffusion coefficients per input signal, enabling the model to adapt to each data's specific characteristics.

items.title: Multivariable Calculus
items.excerpt: This blog will provide comprehensive knowledge on multivariable calculus, covering functions of several variables, partial derivatives, multiple integrals, and vector calculus.

items.title: Linear Algebra
items.excerpt: This blog will provide comprehensive knowledge on linear algebra, covering vectors, matrices, basic operations, and solving linear equations.

items.title: Probability and Statistics
items.excerpt: This blog will provide comprehensive knowledge on probability and statistics, covering probability theory, random variables, probability distributions, statistical inference, and hypothesis testing.

items.title: Convex Optimization
items.excerpt: This blog will provide comprehensive knowledge on convex optimization, covering fundamental concepts of convex sets, convex functions, optimization problems, duality theory, and algorithmic techniques.
